result.execSummary:
All charges against Isaiah T. Jackson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaiah T. Jackson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah T. Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Completion of Representation
Submitted by Atty Zachary Caley
DE's Authorization to Appear and Act

2:01 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Isaiah T. Jackson not in court. Attorney Zachary Caley in court for Isaiah T. Jackson. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Caley provides an authorization signed by the DE and is requesting that his appearance be waived today. Criminal charge in file 22CM447 is dismissed on State's motion. Co. Ordinance citation for Theft filed. Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court. Court imposes $263.50 total fine/costs, 60 days to pay, or 5 days KCJ/work crew.

09:14 AM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Isaiah T. Jackson, appeared with Attorney Zachary Caley.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Caley is requesting an adjournment as he is still investigating and is discussing resolution with the State. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22 mailed to the DE

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Jeffery C Jr, Thera P, LMA, Indian Trail HS

249PM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:10 am.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk
